page.title: 09BOWNESS-ON-SOLWAY.WILDLIFE.
page.content: Its unspoilt and isolated position makes this area an ideal sanctuary for many types of fauna: Roe Deer, Badger, Fox, Weasel, Rabbit,Hedgehog,Hare,Mice Vole, Shrew, Newt, and the Natterjack toad. The peat moss & mainly deciduous wooded areas provide ideal habitats and cover. The area is noted for Adders, & Mink are not uncommon.Grey Seal have been sighted in the Estuary. The coast harbours a variety of wading birds, notably Oystercatcher,Shelduck, Curlew, Plover, Heron, Greenshank. Geese are seen in migratory paths, many to winter at Caerlaverock in Dumfriesshire. Unusual varieties of waders, geese, gulls, birds of prey and smaller perching birds have been sighted,-list available in "Birds in Cumbria" from Cumbria Trust for Nature Conservation. Barn Owls becoming more numerous. Game birds are reared.
